definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The blind man is bound to find the grindstone behind him.
sentences.chinese: 盲人一定會發現他身後的磨石。

sentences.english: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
sentences.chinese: 少年人扛磨石，孩童背木柴，都絆跌了。

sentences.english: He grinds ax on the grindstone.
He is picking the surface of a millstone.
Terrazzo flooring contains hydronic radiant heating.
sentences.chinese: 水磨石地板還能液體循環輻射加熱。

sentences.english: The rail's existing profile is maintained by using special gauge corner grinding stones.
sentences.chinese: 鋼軌斷面使用特殊的軌距邊角磨石來保養。

sentences.english: Sharpening a plane blade requires sharpening stones of various grits and a little oil.
sentences.chinese: 銳化平面刀片需要磨石各種糝和少許油。

sentences.english: And he pulled out this dusty old rock tumbler.
sentences.chinese: 他拖出了一個佈滿灰塵的舊磨石機。

sentences.english: There was once a skilled mason. A master at dressing stone.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前有一個技藝高超的石匠，一位磨石大師。

sentences.english: Construction of cast-in-site terrazzo floor in winter is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 冬期施工現制水磨石地面，是一個施工難點。

sentences.english: The heavy millstone leaves him flat.

definition: to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist
chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
